artists.name: Leonardo da Vinci
artists.bio: Italian Renaissance polymath known for iconic works like 'The Last Supper' and 'Mona Lisa.' His art explores anatomy, light, and religious symbolism.

artists.name: Lowell Bruce Bennet
artists.bio: 20th-century artist celebrated for spiritual themes and symbolic religious representations like 'Adam and Eve.'

artists.name: Fra Angelico
artists.bio: A Dominican friar and early Italian painter whose works reflect deep religious devotion and early Renaissance style.

artists.name: Raphael
artists.bio: One of the great masters of the High Renaissance, known for his serene Madonnas and balanced compositions.

artists.name: Antonio Ciseri
artists.bio: Italian-Swiss painter noted for detailed religious scenes like 'Ecce Homo,' often filled with emotional tension.

artists.name: Caravaggio
artists.bio: Baroque master famous for dramatic use of light and realism in biblical scenes like 'Supper at Emmaus.'

artists.name: Harry Anderson
artists.bio: American illustrator known for Christ-centered works commissioned by religious institutions.

artists.name: William-Adolphe Bouguereau
artists.bio: French academic painter celebrated for classical technique and tender religious imagery like 'L'Innocence.'

artists.name: Carl Heinrich Bloch
artists.bio: Danish painter whose reverent portrayals of Christ have become beloved across Christian communities.

artists.name: Rembrandt
artists.bio: Dutch Golden Age painter, known for emotional intensity and masterful use of light in religious works like 'The Storm on the Sea of Galilee.'

artists.name: Del Parson
artists.bio: Delwin Oliver 'Del Parson' (born 1948) is an American painter who is well known for his Latter-day Saint -themed paintings. His painting of Jesus, 'Christ in Red Robe,' is recognizable from its wide use by the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.
